oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Educational facilities; Rural schools
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Interior view of Mt. Pisgah School. The original rough pine desks are shown with a potbelly stove in the center of the room. One window for light can be seen in the background.
The Macon County history books list the school only as Pisgah and it was probably built in the late 1800s. It stood on land once owned by Thomas Leath.
